raw_text:
Bortolami predicts dour contest
 
 Italy skipper Marco Bortolami believes Saturday's Six Nations contest against Scotland will be a scrappy encounter.
 
 With both sides looking for their first win of the championship, the third-round game at Murrayfield has been billed as a wooden-spoon decider. And Bortolami feels the Edinburgh contest could end up being a bruising battle of the packs. "It will not be a pretty game because both teams are desperate to gain their first win," said the lock forward. Italy have only recorded three wins since they joined the Six Nations in 2000, but two of those have come against Scotland. This year, Italy opened up with a stubborn display against Ireland but ended up losing 28-17.
 
 However, they were thoroughly outplayed by an impressive Welsh side in Rome last time out. Now the Italians travel to Edinburgh hoping to claim their first away win in the Six Nations. "Scotland played extremely well against France in Paris but not so well when Ireland came to Edinburgh," said Bortolami. "We are still very disappointed with our last game against Wales in Rome and we are thoroughly determined to right the wrongs. "As a nation, our quest is to be respected as a team worthy of a place in this tournament and we can only do this by winning games."
llama3.2:1b: Italy's Marco Bortolami predicts a dour contest against Scotland in Saturday's Six Nations game, with both sides looking for their first win. Italy have not won since joining the championship in 2000 but have two wins against Scotland. They will travel to Edinburgh hoping to claim their first away win.
llama3.2:3b: Marco Bortolami predicts a scrappy Six Nations contest between Italy and Scotland at Murrayfield, with both teams looking for their first win. The Italian lock forward believes the game could end up being a battle of the packs, as both sides are desperate to gain momentum. Italy's last two losses were against Ireland and Wales, but Bortolami says they are determined to right those wrongs and earn respect as a team in the tournament.
gemma2:2b: Marco Bortolami predicts a tough, physical Six Nations encounter between Italy and Scotland in Edinburgh. Both teams are seeking their first win of the championship, making it a crucial game for both sides. Italy has historically struggled against Scotland and faces an uphill battle after losing to Ireland and struggling against Wales.  However, they aim to secure their first away win in the tournament and prove their national standing.

Despite two winless performances since joining the competition, Italy hopes to break their losing streak with a third-round victory over an impressively beaten Welsh side.
qwen2.5:3b: Italy skipper Marco Bortolami predicts a tough match against Scotland in their Six Nations contest, viewing it as crucial for both teams' first wins. Both sides are desperate to win, with Italy hoping for an away victory after losing 28-17 to Wales in Rome. Bortolami believes the game could be physical and competitive, reminiscent of previous encounters between the two nations. Despite their recent loss, Scotland demonstrated strong performance against France before falling short against Ireland. Italy aims to right their mistakes from the last match and secure a first away win in the tournament.
